labels.analysis: The MCP Server connects AI assistants to GitHub-hosted Obsidian vaults, allowing users to access, search, and analyze their knowledge bases. Key functionalities include retrieving note contents, searching files/issues, and tracking commit history. It bridges Obsidian notes with AI capabilities, primarily serving knowledge workers, developers, and academics to enhance productivity and project management.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Memory Management" was chosen because the server focuses on accessing and organizing knowledge bases (Obsidian vaults). Secondary labels "Database Operations" and "Development Tools" were selected due to the tool's search capabilities (like databases) and its utility for developers (GitHub integration). No custom label is needed as the predefined options sufficiently cover the functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Obsidian GitHub
server_info_crawled.author: @Hint-Services/obsidian-github-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Connect AI assistants to your GitHub-hosted Obsidian vault to seamlessly access, search, and analyze your knowledge base. Enable intelligent retrieval of notes, track the evolution of your ideas, and integrate project management workflows. Enhance productivity for knowledge workers, developers, and academics by bridging your Obsidian notes with AI capabilities.

tools.name: getFileContents
tools.description: Deploy Server Obsidian GitHub @Hint-Services/obsidian-github-mcp Try in Playground getFileContents

tools.name: searchFiles
tools.description: Search for notes, documents, and files within your Obsidian vault on GitHub (string/string). Find specific knowledge base content using GitHub's powerful search syntax. Supports searching in filenames, paths, and content.

tools.name: searchIssues
tools.description: Search for issues and discussions in your Obsidian vault repository (string/string). Great for tracking tasks, project management, and collaborative knowledge work.

tools.name: getCommitHistory
tools.description: Track the evolution of your Obsidian vault knowledge base by retrieving commit history from GitHub (string/string). See how your notes and ideas have developed over time with detailed diffs.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Hint-Services/obsidian-github-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
